laadan_1823.name: Laadan (of the Gershonite clan)
laadan_1823.bio: White, one of the two sons of Gershon, the son of Levi ([Ex. 6:17](/exod#Exod.6.17); [Num. 3:18](/num#Num.3.18), [21](/num#Num.3.21)).

laban_1803.name: Laban
laban_1803.bio: The son of Bethuel, who was the son of Nahor, Abraham’s brother. He lived at Haran in Mesopotamia. His sister Rebekah was Isaac’s wife ([Gen.

lamech_1808.name: Lamech (descendant of Cain)
lamech_1808.bio: The fifth in descent from Cain. He was the first to violate the primeval ordinance of marriage ([Gen. 4:18-24](/gen#Gen.4.18)).

lamech_1809.name: Lamech (Son of Methuselah)
lamech_1809.bio: The seventh in descent from Seth, being the only son of Methuselah. Noah was the oldest of his several sons ([Gen. 5:25-31](/gen#Gen.5.25); [Luke 3:36](/luke#Luke.3.36)).

lapidoth_1810.name: Lapidoth
lapidoth_1810.bio: Torches. Deborah is called “the wife of Lapidoth” ([Judg. 4:4](/judg#Judg.4.4)).

lazarus_1811.name: Lazarus (Jesus restores him to life four days aft)

lazarus_1812.name: Lazarus (the beggar in a parable told by Jesus in)
lazarus_1812.bio: The brother of Mary and Martha of Bethany. He was raised from the dead after he had lain four days in the tomb ([John 11:1-44](/john#John.11.1)). This miracle so excited the wrath of the Jews that they sought to put both Jesus and Lazarus to death.

leah_1813.name: Leah
leah_1813.bio: Weary, the eldest daughter of Laban, and sister of Rachel ([Gen. 29:16](/gen#Gen.29.16)). Jacob took her to wife through a deceit of her father ([Gen.

lebbaeus_1815.name: Lebbaeus
lebbaeus_1815.bio: courageous, a surname of Judas (Jude), one of the twelve ( Matthew 10:3 ), called also Thaddaeus, not to be confounded with the Judas who was the brother of our Lord.

lemuel_1817.name: Lemuel
lemuel_1817.bio: Dedicated to God, a king whom his mother instructed ([Prov. 31:1-9](/prov#Prov.31.1)). Nothing is certainly known concerning him.

leummim_1819.name: Leummim
leummim_1819.bio: Peoples; nations, the last mentioned of the three sons of Dedan, and head of an Arabian tribe ([Gen. 25:3](/gen#Gen.25.3)).

levi_1820.name: Levi (of Twelve Tribes)
levi_1820.bio: The third son of Jacob by Leah. The origin of the name is found in Leah’s words ([Gen. 29:34](/gen#Gen.29.34)), “This time will my husband be joined [Heb.

levi_1822.name: Levi (Founder of the Tribe of Levi)
levi_1822.bio: The father of Matthat, and son of Simeon, of the ancestors of Christ ([Luke 3:29](/luke#Luke.3.29)).

lo-ammi_1827.name: Lo-ammi
lo-ammi_1827.bio: Not my people, a symbolical name given by God’s command to Hosea’s second son in token of Jehovah’s rejection of his people ([Hos. 1:9](/hos#Hos.1.9), [10](/hos#Hos.1.10)), his treatment of them as a foreign people. This Hebrew word is rendered by “not my people” in ver.

lo-ruhamah_1829.name: Lo-ruhamah
lo-ruhamah_1829.bio: Not pitied, the name of the prophet Hosea’s first daughter, a type of Jehovah’s temporary rejection of his people ([Hos. 1:6](/hos#Hos.1.6); [2:23](/hos#Hos.2.23)).

lois_1828.name: Lois
lois_1828.bio: The maternal grandmother of Timothy. She is commended by Paul for her faith ([2 Tim. 1:5](/2tim#2Tim.1.5)).

lot_1830.name: Lot
lot_1830.bio: (Heb. goral, a “pebble”), a small stone used in casting lots ([Num. 33:54](/num#Num.33.54); [Jonah 1:7](/jonah#Jonah.1.7)).

lotan_1831.name: Lotan
lotan_1831.bio: Coverer, one of the sons of Seir, the Horite ([Gen. 36:20](/gen#Gen.36.20), [29](/gen#Gen.36.29)).

lucifer_1832.name: Lucifer
lucifer_1832.bio: Brilliant star, a title given to the king of Babylon ([Isa. 14:12](/isa#Isa.14.12)) to denote his glory.

lucius_1833.name: Lucius
lucius_1833.bio: of Cyrene, a Christian teacher at Antioch ( Acts 13:1 ), and Paul's kinsman ( Romans 16:21 ). His name is Latin, but his birthplace seems to indicate that he was one of the Jews of Cyrene, in North Africa.

lud_1834.name: Lud
lud_1834.bio: The fourth son of Shem ([Gen. 10:22](/gen#Gen.10.22); [1 Chr. 1:17](/1chr#1Chr.1.17)), ancestor of the Lydians probably.

ludim_1835.name: Ludim
ludim_1835.bio: Probably the same as Lud (2) (comp. [Gen. 10:13](/gen#Gen.10.13); [1 Chr.

luke_1836.name: Luke
luke_1836.bio: The evangelist, was a Gentile. The date and circumstances of his conversion are unknown. According to his own statement ([Luke 1:2](/luke#Luke.1.2)), he was not an “eye-witness and minister of the word from the beginning.” It is probable that he was a physician in Troas, and was there converted by Paul, to whom he attached himself.

lydia_1837.name: Lydia
lydia_1837.bio: A woman of Thyatira, a "seller of purple," who dwelt in Philippi ( Acts 16:14 Acts 16:15 ). She was not a Jewess but a proselyte. The Lord opened her heart as she heard the gospel from the lips of Paul ( 16:13 ).

lysanias_1838.name: Lysanias
lysanias_1838.bio: Tetrarch of Abilene ([Luke 3:1](/luke#Luke.3.1)), on the eastern slope of Anti-Lebanon, near the city of Damascus.
